attributes.action: Reduce the retirement age for Prison Officers from 68 to 60 in line with Police.
attributes.additional_details:
Mental & Physical Demands: Daily violence, stress & physical interventions, making working until 68 unrealistic. 

Health Impacts: One of the most stressful jobs with most not reaching retirement age, or going off unwell.

Disparity with Police, Army & Firefighters: Other services retire at 60.

Safety Concerns: Older officers may struggle to restrain younger fit prisoners, causing safety issues. 

Retention & Recruitment: This retirement age deters recruits & increases attrition.
attributes.background:
